item.title: Operators to face Adult Content Restrictions
item.description:
The Australian communications minister Helen Coonan plans to introduce to parliament legislation to extend the current safeguards that apply to content delivered over the internet or television to content delivered over convergent devices such as mobile phones.

This will include prohibition of content rated X18+ and above, as well as requirements for consumer advice and age-restrictions on access to content suited only to adults. This has impact across the board as for most people the internet is seen to be ‘open’ and attempts to block porn are like trying to plug holes in a leaking dam. Operators have also argued they should be treated like ISP’s and can’t be held responsible for what customers do with their phones

item.title: Manage a diverse range of handsets, don't just stop selling them
item.description: It seems only yesterday that operators were switching off their analogue mobile networks, yet now its the turn of the retailer to make to turn off the switch. Online retail brand Dixon’s reports they will stop selling analogue radios and that the death is imminent also for portable stereos and CD players. I guess the portable tapeplayer and VHS are already ‘dead’ by their reckoning. For mobile operators, the problem is confounded by the need to actually support all this old tech stuff.

item.title: SMS pricing initiatives
item.description:
Summary: Operators are competing with large bundles of ‘free’ text messages. This pricing prevents text over IP or other apps taking off, but there is still a long way to go to grow data usage.

There is still alot of work to be done to grow data usage across the business and consumer base. One of the challenges is working out pricing. In Ireland, they are trialling €49 per month unlimited plan. In T-mobile UK they have a £7.50 unlimited data plan but services like Skype are barred.

item.title: There's a light
item.description: In the news today, seven of the big name operators are forming an industry organisation to create a common 4G mobile phone network standard.

item.title: What's in a disconnect?
item.description: summary: customer care can only go so far, when the customer’s relationship starts to fail with an operator, people will look for new solutions.

item.title: Advertising on your mobile
item.description: Summary: We still have a long way to go to accept adverts on your mobile.

item.title: HSDPA rollout tops 100 Networks
item.description: An article on http://3g.co.uk reports that the number of HSDPA networks (known as 3G Broadband) has now topped 100.

item.title: Some thoughts on the BBC Creative Future
item.description: So the BBC have released their Creative Futures report yesterday looking at the future of the Beeb.

item.title: Take Note of your Customer Care
item.description: Opinion: There are many online services that customers will turn to for support when your customer service goes bad - be on top of what is going on.

item.title: Gmail for your mobile
item.description: Google has created a special version of its Gmail e-mail service that provides mobile phone users with quick access to their e-mail.

item.title: RSS to SMS for your mobile
item.description: Think about this carefully - any RSS stream sent free to your mobile by SMS - you’ve got your blackberry, you’ve got your live news alerts and weekly MMS updates - but who tells you about that other stuff you’re really really interested in?

item.title: Mobile Blogging Reduces Churn
item.description: MocoNews.net: mobile content news: “Mobile Blogging generates an immediate reduction of up to 70% in the propensity of a user to churn.

item.title: US findings from Content Survey
item.description: interesting global research on mobile phones from a US university.

item.title: Rude Food - National Vegie Week
item.description: Rude Food sex and food won’t ever seem the same again!

item.title: Coen Brothers, Kaufmann and more -
item.description: I actually wasn’t sure what to expect never being to a sound play / radio play before.

item.title: AUSTRALIA GETS DRUNK, WAKES UP IN NORTH ATLANTIC
item.description: Tired of Being Isolated and Ignored, Continent Isn’t Bloody Moving

item.title: 26 Thoughts to Get You Through a Crisis
item.description: Indecision is the key to flexibility. You can’t tell which way the train went by looking at the track.

item.title: Last Sightings of Turkey
item.description: so it was back to getting up early! well 630am! before a short ride to the port of Kusadasi and then goodbye to Turkey.

item.title: Turkey Pammukale
item.description: Tukery 2004 - Pammukale .. the calcium rich water comes up to the surface creating these amazing terraces

item.title: Thoughts on Turkey
item.description: All Turkish men shave there armpits .. weird .. dont ask me why!
